business.headline: Stocks to watch on July 3: Nykaa, RVNL, Nestle, Yes Bank, Dmart, PNBInvestors are now watching company announcements for the April–June quarter results, while developments related to a possible trade deal between India and the United States are also being closely followed.

Retiring without children? Here's how to plan for a comfortable and secure futureToday, more and more Indians are choosing to remain child-free or find themselves without direct heirs for various reasons. For them, retirement planning isn't just about saving money and building a corpus, it's about securing comfort, care, dignity, and independence in their golden years.

Sensex ends 288 points lower, Nifty settles below 25, 500; Tata Steel down 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 287.60 points to end at 83,409.69, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 88.40 points to end at 25,453.40.

Need your UAN? Here's how to get it and manage your PF smoothlyThe biggest advantage of a UAN is its permanence. It doesn't change when you change jobs. It ties together all your PF accounts, making fund tracking and management simple and paperless.

57% of Indians call skills critical, but relevant frameworks still lag: ReportAon's 2025 APAC Skills Impact Survey reveals what really matters for Indian firms today. It reveals that for the next two to three years, Indian firms are prioritising talent retention, leadership pipelines, and workforce agility.

Investor earns Rs 7 lakh, faces Rs 74,000 tax despite Rs 12 lakh limit. Know whySujit Bangar, founder of TaxBuddy.com and a former IRS officer, shared the example on LinkedIn to warn investors against a common misconception.

Don't ignore your EPF: Here's why checking it regularly mattersExperts warn that many salaried employees don't realise until it's too late that their employer hasn't been depositing funds, or that a simple KYC error has locked their money away.

Stock market holidays July 2025: Here's what traders should knowBefore you plan your next trade or check your stocks, it helps to know if the market is open. Here's a quick look at whether the NSE and BSE will have any holidays this July.
Ghee, soap and snacks to get cheaper? Big GST cut likely, say sourcesSources say the government is weighing a major rejig of GST slabs that could bring down the tax burden on everyday essentials.
Wanting to switch tax regime? Here's how to do it while filing ITRIf you're a salaried employee with no business or professional income, you have the flexibility to choose the tax regime every year.

HDB Financial lists at 13% premium: Should you book profit or hold?HDB Financial share price: The stock opened at Rs 835 on both the NSE and BSE, compared to its IPO price of Rs 740 per share. This was better than what the grey market had expected, which had estimated a gain of around 8% to 10% on listing day.

SBI classifies Reliance Communications loan account as 'fraud'In a stock exchange filing, Reliance Communications stated that SBI has decided in connection with credit facilities dating back to August 2016.

HDB Financial shares make strong debut with 13% premium on stock marketHDB Financial shares listed at a premium of 13%. The stock made its debut at Rs 835 on both the NSE and BSE, marking a 12.84% gain (Rs 95) over the issue price of Rs 740.

Ola, Uber get government okay for surge pricing, can charge double the base fareStates have been advised to implement the updated guidelines within the next three months. The revised fare structure is aimed at giving platforms flexibility during high-demand periods, while maintaining an overall regulatory framework for pricing and operations.
Sensex, Nifty open higher as IT stocks rally on hopes of US-India trade dealThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 103.13 points to 83,800.42, while the NSE Nifty50 added 21 points to 25,562.80 as of 9:28 am.

HDB Financials listing: GMP signals premium on market debut. Check hereThe company's shares will be listed on both the BSE and NSE. HDB Financial Services is a subsidiary of HDFC Bank and its IPO closed on June 27 with nearly 27 times the subscription.

Stock market opening: Sensex, Nifty to rally over US-India trade deal?Gift Nifty futures, which are seen as an early indicator for Indian market openings, traded at 25,686.50 points at 8:24 am. This suggests that the Nifty 50 index could open higher than its previous closing level of 25,541.8.

Stocks to watch on July 2: HAL, Hyundai, Maruti Suzuki, RIL, RITES, V-MartHero MotoCorp reported a year-on-year rise in total sales by 10% to 5.54 lakh units in June, compared to 5.03 lakh units last year. Domestic sales rose by 6.9% to 5.25 lakh units.

July turns hot for IPOs as firms race to raise $2.4 billionFirms are gearing up to raise around $2.4 billion through initial public offerings (IPOs) in July. If this target is reached, it will mark the strongest IPO month since December 2023, following a solid $2 billion raised in June.

India-US trade pact: Deadlock over tariffs as negotiations continueIndia and the US are yet to reach an agreement on their trade pact, with tariffs being a major point of contention. India is pushing for zero tariffs in certain sectors, while the US wants to maintain a 10% tariff.
Sensex closes 91 points higher, Nifty above 25,500; RIL up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 90.83 points to end at 83,697.29, while the NSE Nifty50 added 24.75 points to close at 25,541.80.

From tax to tatkal trains: July 1 money changes that matter to youThe CBDT has extended the last date for filing Income Tax Returns (ITR) for salaried individuals. Instead of July 31, the new deadline is now September 15.

India may finalise interim trade deal with US this week: ReportBoth sides are racing to complete the deal before July 9, when the US is set to impose a 26% reciprocal tariff on Indian goods. These tariffs were first announced by President Donald Trump in April and temporarily suspended for 90 days.

Digital India turns 10, PM Modi says it's become a people's movementIn the blog titled 'A Decade of Digital India', on LinkedIn, PM Modi said the Digital India initiative is no longer just a government programme but a 'people's movement.'
Why India's ultra-rich love family officesForget yachts. For India's ultra-rich, the ultimate power move is a family office. Read on to see why it's becoming the new gold standard of wealth.

New York tops billionaire list. Which Indian city made it to the top 10?Globally, nearly a quarter of the world's 3,028 billionaires live in just 10 cities across six countries. These cities continue to attract wealth due to strong business ecosystems, investor-friendly policies, and thriving industries.
Sensex opens flat, Nifty above 25,500; Asian Paints up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 186.04 points to 83,792.50, while the NSE Nifty50 added 56.35 points to 25,573.40 as of 9:28 am.

SBI turns 70: Why bank's blue keyhole has stood the test of timeAfter independence, under the first 5-year plan's push for rural development, the government nationalised the Imperial Bank. On July 1, 1955, the State Bank of India was born under the State Bank of India Act.

MS Dhoni files for trademark of iconic nickname 'Captain Cool'Over the years, 'Captain Cool' has meant much more than just a catchy title. It sums up Dhoni's calm mind under pressure, from winning India's first T20 World Cup in 2007 to lifting the ODI World Cup in 2011 and the Champions Trophy in 2013.
Sensex ends 450 points lower, Nifty below 25,600; Trent gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex fell 452.44 points to close at 83,606.46, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 120.75 points, ending below the 25,600 mark.

Look rich or be rich: Startup founder on middle class dilemmaToday, many people in the middle class are busy trying to look rich, rather than actually becoming rich. Costly gadgets, fancy brunches and trendy holidays are often paid for with loans and EMIs, says founder and CEO, Shyam Achuthan.

8 years of GST: Top 5 achievements you should knowSince its launch, GST has strengthened India's revenue and expanded the taxpayer base, with collections reaching a record Rs 22.08 lakh crore in 2024–25, as per PIB.

IndusInd Bank submits CEO shortlist to RBI after leadership exits: ReportThe candidates include Rajiv Anand, Rahul Shukla, and Anup Saha — all experienced financial sector leaders. The move comes after the abrupt exits of CEO Sumant Kathpalia and deputy Arun Khurana in April, following a $230 million hit from years of misaccounting in internal derivative trades.

Rural India holds steady as urban consumption slows, finds Equirus SecuritiesThe mood remains subdued overall, but analysts note an undercurrent of recovery in rural pockets, led by fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG), electric mobility and segments of real estate.

Filing ITR without a CA? 5 common mistakes that you must avoidMany people mix up the financial year and assessment year. For income earned in 2024-25, the assessment year will be 2025-26. Pick this carefully or your return will not be valid.

Terms agreed and locked, India-US trade deal likely before July 8The much-awaited deal comes just in the nick of time, as Trump's deadline for imposing reciprocal tariffs on countries worldwide ends on July 9. Last week, Trump said his administration was looking to remove all trade barriers, which he called 'unthinkable'.

Government's favourite baby: Investment banker on India's real estate boomInvestment banker Sarthak Ahuja says India's real estate sector isn't in a bubble—it's backed by policy, jobs, and demographics, making it a long-term priority for the government.

Explained: Why JB Chemicals shares plunged over 6% todayThe market reaction came swiftly after Torrent Pharmaceuticals announced it will acquire a controlling 46.39% stake in JB Pharma from global investment firm KKR, with plans to subsequently merge the two companies.
Adani Enterprises to raise Rs 1,000 crore via retail bondsThe proposed bonds have been rated AA- by both ICRA and Care Ratings, signalling a relatively stable credit outlook.

Most corrupt I've seen: Finfluencer on Indian metro real estate marketFinfluencer Akshat Shrivastava is calling metro real estate a "financial ruin," warning middle-class buyers to stop chasing low-yield properties bankrolled by black money and billionaire hoarders.

entertainment.headline: Nayanthara, Vignesh Shivan slammed for working with sexual assault accusedTamil director Vignesh Shivan was criticised for working with choreographer Jani Master, who was accused of sexual assault in POCSO case. A few fans pulled up his actor-wife and producer Nayanthara to provide a platform for abusers.

Sean 'Diddy' Combs denied bail after mixed verdict in sex crimes trialSean "Diddy" Combs remains in custody after a split jury verdict. Acquitted of sex trafficking, he was convicted of transporting individuals for prostitution and faces up to 10 years.

Deepika Padukone scripts history, to get a star on Hollywood Walk of Fame in 2026Actor Deepika Padukone became the first Indian actress to make it to the Hollywood Walk of Fame's Class of 2026 list, marking a historic achievement in global cinema and representation of Indian talent.

The Traitors: Actor Elnaaz Norouzi prepared for six months, read psychology booksActor Elnaaz Norouzi opened up about her six-month preparation for 'The Traitors' in a recent YouTube video. The actor disclosed reading several books on human psychology.

Shanaya Kapoor opens up on trolls, says she reads negative comments to get betterAhead of her debut in 'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan', Shanaya Kapoor shared that she actively reads negative comments to understand audience feedback and improve her craft. Despite facing brutal remarks about her appearance, she filters the noise and takes criticism positively.

Internet compares Brad Pitt's F1 to Ta Ra Rum Pum: Director Siddharth Anand reactsDirector Siddharth Anand responded to social media memes that 'Ta Ra Rum Pum' inspired Brad Pitt's 'F1'. The Hollywood drama released in theatres on June 27.

Apoorva Mukhija on life after The Traitors: I want to get marriedApoorva Mukhija shared that she now wants to get married and take a break from reality shows and content creation. Currently, a part of the OTT reality show 'The Traitors', she joked about having a swayamvar.

Sean 'Diddy' Combs not guilty of sex trafficking, convicted on lesser chargeSean 'Diddy Combs' was convicted of a prostitution-related felony but acquitted of sex trafficking and racketeering charges that could have led to a life sentence.

Diljit Dosanjh's BTS video dismisses Border 2 exit buzz amid Sardaar Ji 3 backlashDiljit Dosanjh refuted rumours of being replaced in 'Border 2'. The actor shared a video from the sets of the upcoming film.

Meet engineer who is playing main role in India's 1st Rs 835 crore epic filmAn actor known for donning many hats, who transitioned from engineering to television shows, will next be seen in the most expensive Indian film. Married to a famous Indian actor and his business partner, he is not Ranveer Singh or Vicky Kaushal.

Heads of State X review: Priyanka Chopra's film is a perfect popcorn action flickMost of the social media users gave 'Heads of State' featuring Priyanka Chopra, John Cena and Idris Alba a thumbs up on X. The film premiered on Prime Video today.

Priyanka Chopra on her Heads of State role: Director felt important to have a womanPriyanka Chopra, in an exclusive interview with India Today, spoke about her role in the latest release, 'Heads of State'. The actor even spoke about female-driven roles in cinema.

Ban Pak content: Film body to PM as channels and accounts reappear on social mediaThe Instagram accounts of Saba Qamar, Mawra Hocane and other Pakistani artistes were made available in India from July 2. AICWA has now written a letter to PM Narendra Modi, highlighting the reappearance of Pakistani content in India and the need for a complete ban.

3BHK review: Siddharth, Sarathkumar power through feel-good drama that hits homeReleased-Fri Jul 04, 20253BHK movie review: Director Sri Ganesh's '3BHK' starring Siddharth, Sarathkumar and Meetha Raghunath, is an endearing story about the struggles of a middle-class family. With heartfelt emotions and layered storytelling, the film is a mirror that reflects reality.

Maniesh Paul to play villain in KJo's next? His new look leaves fans curiousActor Maniesh Paul hinted at his next film by sharing photos of his new look on Instagram. The photos left fans and celebrities curious whether Paul would be playing a villain in the film.

Squid Game 3 breaks Netflix records with 60.1 million views in 3 days'Squid Game Season 3' has shattered Netflix records with over 60 million views in just three days. The final season strengthens the franchise's global legacy while sparking talks of a US adaptation.

Anurag Basu credits Irrfan for Metro In Dino: This film is a tribute to him and KKDirector Anurag Basu, in an interview, credited Irrfan for 'Metro In Dino'. The upcoming film is a spiritual sequel to 'Life In A Metro.'

Exclusive: Priyanka Chopra on missing Hindi films, SSMB29, and upcoming projectsPriyanka Chopra's latest Hollywood action-comedy 'Heads of State', co-starring John Cena and Idris Elba, is now streaming on Prime Video. In an exclusive interview with India Today, the actor opened up about her excitement for her next Indian film.

Exclusive: John Cena credits Indian fans for his global reach, says is fortunateHollywood stars Priyanka Chopra and John Cena expressed deep gratitude and personal connection to India as their film 'Heads of State' released on Prime Video on July 2. Both actors cherished the warmth of Indian fans and look forward to continuing their journey with strong ties to Indian audiences.

general news.headline: Ban on Pak social media accounts reinstated again amid backlashInstagram and Twitter profiles of Pakistani celebrities such as Hania Aamir, Shahid Afridi and Mahira Khan once again became inaccessible to Indian users.

3 Indians abducted by Al Qaeda-linked terrorists in Mali, rescue efforts underwayAl-Qaeda-linked Jama'at Nusrat al-Islam wal-Muslimin, suspected in the Mali abduction, has carried out multiple attacks across the West African nation.

PM Modi receives Ghana's national honour 'Officer of the Order of the Star'PM Narendra Modi received Ghana's national honour 'Officer of the Order of the Star' for global leadership during the historic state visit, the first by an Indian PM in three decades.

Shubman Gill's symphony at Edgbaston: Abbey Road, not autotuneENG vs IND, 2nd Test: At Edgbaston, Shubman Gill crafted a well-compiled 114  not out off 216 balls, leading India's batting charge on a topsy-turvy day. Calm and unhurried, Gill batted with remarkable control to bring up his second century as Test captain in as many matches.

Unified GCC tourist visa for six Gulf nations to launch soon: What to knowA single-entry visa that permits visitors to enter six Gulf nations with a single permit is being introduced by the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC). It will be valid for 30 to 90 days. A valid passport, a photo, travel information, and evidence of housing and financial support are required for online applications.

News Menu, July 3: PM Modi's global quest; Amarnath Yatra beginsIn today's News Menu: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's longest diplomatic mission of a 5-nation tour continues, Maharashtra Navnirman Sena workers were filmed assaulting a shop owner for not speaking Marathi, Amarnath Yatra begins from Pahalgam and Baltal amid tight security, heavy rain and cloudburst continue to lash Himachal Pradesh.

Amit Shah congratulates narcotics bureau for busting global drug cartelAmit Shah congratulated the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) global drug cartel bust in which eight people were arrested. The US and Australia acted on India's leads in Operation Med Max involving crypto, drop-shipping and digital trafficking.

There will not be a Hamastan: Netanyahu calls for end to HamasIsraeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu vowed to destroy Hamas, rejecting any future role for the group, even as Hamas said it is reviewing a new ceasefire plan backed by Trump. The proposal includes a 60-day truce in Gaza.

Deepika Padukone scripts history, to get a star on Hollywood Walk of Fame in 2026Actor Deepika Padukone became the first Indian actress to make it to the Hollywood Walk of Fame's Class of 2026 list, marking a historic achievement in global cinema and representation of Indian talent.
Kolkata rape accused Manojit Mishra's lawyer license cancelledThe Bar Council acted seven days after receiving a formal complaint regarding the incident.

Op Sindoor delegations conveyed national unity message: Jaishankar to Quad leadersJaishankar said that since Parliamentarians from different parties participated in the global outreach, it was India's "political pluralism" coming together for a common cause in the national interest, which was great.

SpiceJet aircraft's window frame comes loose mid-air, airline says no riskA window frame of a Goa-Pune SpiceJet flight came loose mid-air, sending passengers into a frenzy. However, the window frame was fixed at Pune airport and the airline said there was no risk to passengers' safety.

Day 1: Shubman Gill's hundred takes spotlight off selection scrutinyEngland vs India, 2nd Test: Captain Shubman Gill scored a superb century to help India recover from a mini-collapse at the start of the final session. India ended Day 1 on 310 for 5, with Gill and Ravindra Jadeja (41) sharing a crucial 99-run unbeaten partnership.

Nitish Kumar, PM Modi face of NDA in Bihar polls: Rajnath SinghAt the BJP's state committee meeting in Patna, Rajnath Singh backed Nitish Kumar's leadership, urging party workers to promote PM Modi's work and counter opposition lies with facts.

Notice to lawyer over 'why leave early' remark after 3 die in 40-hour highway jamAn NHAI lawyer, who sparked a row over his 'why people leave home early' remark during a court hearing on the deaths of three people in a 40-hour Madhya Pradesh highway jam, was issued a show-cause notice.

Iran halts cooperation with UN nuclear watchdog, US calls move unacceptableThe US has urged Iran to resume full cooperation with the IAEA after President Pezeshkian signed a law halting inspections. The US called the move "unacceptable" and warned Iran against using it to gain leverage.

Teacher organises ramp walk for students in classroom. Adorable video goes viralThe viral video shows students taking turns strutting down the aisle between desks like a runway, while their classmates cheered for them.

Illegal immigrant started eating himself up while being deported: US officialUS Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said that an illegal immigrant, who she described as a "cannibal", began eating himself up during a deportation flight. She cited the example to justify that American federal agents were targeting the "worst of the worst" illegal immigrants in the US, not hard-working community members.

Nayanthara, Vignesh Shivan slammed for working with sexual assault accusedTamil director Vignesh Shivan was criticised for working with choreographer Jani Master, who was accused of sexual assault in POCSO case. A few fans pulled up his actor-wife and producer Nayanthara to provide a platform for abusers.

Yashasvi Jaiswal breaks 51-year-old record with 87 in Birmingham TestENG vs IND: Yashasvi Jaiswal recorded the highest individual score by an Indian batter in Tests at Edgbaston in Birmingham, going past Sudhir Naik's 51-year-old record.

ChatGPT helps US woman pay off her $23,000 credit card debtA realtor from Delaware in the US used ChatGPT as her financial advisor to tackle her credit card debt. The AI chatbot reportedly helped her find over $10,000 in unclaimed funds and save nearly $600 monthly. She credited ChatGPT's consistent support for helping her pay the debt.

Woman kills mother-in-law over land dispute, had affairs with husband's 2 brothersA woman in Uttar Pradesh's Jhansi killed her mother-in-law over a land dispute. Police said the accused had affairs with two brothers of her late husband. The accused also stole the victim's jewellery and attempted to sell it off.

Unidentified interstellar object flying from outside Solar System discoveredThe object was first noticed by NASA's Asteroid Terrestrial-impact Last Alert System (ATLAS), with further observations quickly pouring in from both professional and amateur astronomers worldwide.

Bihar voter rolls revision unreasonable, say Opposition parties in Delhi meetOpposition leaders meet in Delhi and object to voter rolls revision in Bihar ahead of the Assembly elections, citing timing and restrictions by the Election Commission.

sports.headline: Shubman Gill's symphony at Edgbaston: Abbey Road, not autotuneENG vs IND, 2nd Test: At Edgbaston, Shubman Gill crafted a well-compiled 114  not out off 216 balls, leading India's batting charge on a topsy-turvy day. Calm and unhurried, Gill batted with remarkable control to bring up his second century as Test captain in as many matches.

Shubman Gill has clear plans, there's no confusion: Yashasvi on selection chatterENG vs IND, 2nd Test: Yashasvi Jaiswal said that captain Shubman Gill has clear plans for the Indian team and there is no confusion regarding team selection for the Edgbaston Test. Jasprit Bumrah was rested for the game and Kuldeep Yadav was left out, leading to a lot of noise on Day 1 regarding the call.

Jasmine Paolini stunned in Round 2, Alcaraz, Raducanu progressWimbledon 2025: Kamilla Rakhimova handed Jasmine Paolini a shock defeat, winning in three sets. Emma Raducanu and Carlos Alcaraz secured their berths in the third round of the grass court major.

Rohan Bopanna crashes out, Yuki Bhambri, Rithvik Bollipalli advanceWimbledon 2025: Yuki Bhambri and Rithvik Bollipalli made their way through to the second round of men's doubles, but veteran Rohan Bopanna failed to go beyond the opening round.

Carlsen makes bold assessment of Gukesh at Grand Chess: One of weaker playersMagnus Carlsen has made a bold statement about reigning world champion Gukesh, questioning the teenager's credentials in faster formats by saying the youngest classical world champion in history "hasn't done anything to indicate he's going to do well in such a tournament.

Day 1: Shubman Gill's hundred takes spotlight off selection scrutinyEngland vs India, 2nd Test: Captain Shubman Gill scored a superb century to help India recover from a mini-collapse at the start of the final session. India ended Day 1 on 310 for 5, with Gill and Ravindra Jadeja (41) sharing a crucial 99-run unbeaten partnership.

ENG vs IND: Captain Shubman Gill emulates Virat Kohli with gritty Edgbaston hundredShubman Gill emulated Virat Kohli as he became the fourth Indian captain to score consecutive hundreds in their first two Tests. Gill got to his seventh hundred, showing his grit and determination.

Bangladesh lose 1st ODI after humiliating collapse vs Sri LankaSL vs BAN: Sri Lanka took a 1-0 lead in the three-match series after beating Bangladesh by 77 runs in the opening game on Wednesday, July 2, at the R. Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

India edge closer to Women's Asia Cup qualification with Iraq thrashingThe Indian women's team edge closer to qualification to the AFC Women's Asia Cup as they thrashed Iraq 5-0 on Wednesday, July 2. India needs one more win to make it to the AFC Asia Cup 2027.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi hits second-fastest fifty by an Indian in U19 ODIsVaibhav Suryavanshi scored the second-fastest fifty by an Indian batter in an Under-19 ODI during the third Youth ODI against England on Wednesday. The left-hander reached his half-century in just 20 balls, bringing it up with a six off England's James Minto.

Omkar Salvi retained as Mumbai head coach after key domestic winsRoyal Challengers Bengaluru bowling coach Omkar Salvi will continue as the head coach of the Mumbai senior team, the Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA) confirmed on Wednesday.

ENG vs IND: Captain Shubman Gill emulates Virat Kohli with gritty Edgbaston hundredShubman Gill emulated Virat Kohli as he became the fourth Indian captain to score consecutive hundreds in their first two Tests. Gill got to his seventh hundred, showing his grit and determination.

Bangladesh lose 1st ODI after humiliating collapse vs Sri LankaSL vs BAN: Sri Lanka took a 1-0 lead in the three-match series after beating Bangladesh by 77 runs in the opening game on Wednesday, July 2, at the R. Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

India edge closer to Women's Asia Cup qualification with Iraq thrashingThe Indian women's team edge closer to qualification to the AFC Women's Asia Cup as they thrashed Iraq 5-0 on Wednesday, July 2. India needs one more win to make it to the AFC Asia Cup 2027.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi hits second-fastest fifty by an Indian in U19 ODIsVaibhav Suryavanshi scored the second-fastest fifty by an Indian batter in an Under-19 ODI during the third Youth ODI against England on Wednesday. The left-hander reached his half-century in just 20 balls, bringing it up with a six off England's James Minto.

Omkar Salvi retained as Mumbai head coach after key domestic winsRoyal Challengers Bengaluru bowling coach Omkar Salvi will continue as the head coach of the Mumbai senior team, the Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA) confirmed on Wednesday.

Aryna Sabalenka survives Bouzkova scare, Madison Keys into Round 3Wimbledon 2025: Aryna Sabalenka has gone through to the third round after beating Marie Bouzkova in straight sets. Madison Keys and Cameron Norrie also won their respective second-round matches.

Ben Stokes dismisses Yashasvi Jaiswal moments after intense war of wordsBen Stokes turned the heat up at Edgbaston on Day 1 of the second Test, removing Yashasvi Jaiswal moments after a tense exchange of words with the young Indian opener.

Yashasvi Jaiswal breaks 51-year-old record with 87 in Birmingham TestENG vs IND: Yashasvi Jaiswal recorded the highest individual score by an Indian batter in Tests at Edgbaston in Birmingham, going past Sudhir Naik's 51-year-old record.

Asian champion Yarraji suffers injury, in big blow to World Championships hopesAsian champion and national record holder Jyothi Yarraji's bid for a spot at the World Athletics Championships later this year has suffered a major blow after the hurdler picked up a "freak" knee injury during training.

Bengaluru stampede: BCCI Ombudsman tells RCB, KSCA to file written submissionsRoyal Challengers Bengaluru and KSCA have been directed to submit written replies over the fatal stampede during IPL victory celebrations by the BCCI Ombudsman Arun Mishra. The complainant has also told the Ombudsman to prevent the RCB owners from selling the franchise.

Premier League: Chelsea raids Brighton again as Joao Pedro joins on 7-year dealChelsea has completed a successful raid of Brighton and Hove Albion once again as they sign Joao Pedro on a seven-year deal on Wednesday, July 2. Pedro has been signed for a reported fee of 60 million pounds.

Jasprit Bumrah sits out after 7 days' rest! Ravi Shastri slams selection callRavi Shastri has slammed the Indian team management's call to rest Jasprit Bumrah for the Edgbaston Test. Bumrah was one of the three changes that the Indian team made for the second Test.

Never felt this empty: Zverev contemplates therapy after shock exitWimbledon 2025: Alexander Zverev said that he hasn't been in a good mental place after crashing out in the first round following his defeat to Arthur Rinderknech.

Bengaluru stampede: BCCI Ombudsman tells RCB, KSCA to file written submissionsRoyal Challengers Bengaluru and KSCA have been directed to submit written replies over the fatal stampede during IPL victory celebrations by the BCCI Ombudsman Arun Mishra. The complainant has also told the Ombudsman to prevent the RCB owners from selling the franchise.

Premier League: Chelsea raids Brighton again as Joao Pedro joins on 7-year dealChelsea has completed a successful raid of Brighton and Hove Albion once again as they sign Joao Pedro on a seven-year deal on Wednesday, July 2. Pedro has been signed for a reported fee of 60 million pounds.

Jasprit Bumrah sits out after 7 days' rest! Ravi Shastri slams selection callRavi Shastri has slammed the Indian team management's call to rest Jasprit Bumrah for the Edgbaston Test. Bumrah was one of the three changes that the Indian team made for the second Test.

Never felt this empty: Zverev contemplates therapy after shock exitWimbledon 2025: Alexander Zverev said that he hasn't been in a good mental place after crashing out in the first round following his defeat to Arthur Rinderknech.

ZIM vs SA: Maharaj ruled out of 2nd Test, Mulder to lead South AfricaSouth Africa's stand-in skipper, Keshav Maharaj, has been ruled out of the second Test against Zimbabwe due to a groin injury. Wiaan Mulder will lead the Proteas side in his absence.

Manolo Marquez steps down as India coach after mutual agreement with AIFFManolo Marquez and All India Football Federation (AIFF) have decided to part ways as the Spaniard steps down as the India men's team coach.

Shami made me quit job, must pay maintenance: Estranged wife on court orderHasin Jahan, the estranged wife of Mohammed Shami, welcomed the directive of the Calcutta High Court, which ordered the fast bowler to pay Rs 4 lakh monthly alimony. She said Shami made her quit her job and he needed to take responsibility.

Baffling: Sunil Gavaskar tears into Kuldeep Yadav snub in 2nd Test vs EnglandENG vs IND: Sunil Gavaskar was left baffled after Shubman Gill revealed that they had decided to go with an extended batting unit instead of bringing in an attacking bowler like Kuldeep Yadav for the second Test at Birmingham.

Rishabh Pant climbs to sixth in ICC Test rankings after twin centuriesIndia's wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant continued his ascent in the ICC Test Rankings, climbing to sixth place in the latest list released on Wednesday.

Wimbledon, Day 3 Highlights: Jasmine Paolini knocked out, Carlos Alcaraz into Round 3Wimbledon, Day 3 Live updates: Aryna Sabalenka went through to Round 3 after beating Marie Bouzkova of the Czech Republic. Emma Raducanu and Carlos Alcaraz also advanced, while India's Yuki Bhambri also advanced to the third round.

India rest Jasprit Bumrah in 2nd Test, no Kuldeep Yadav in playing XIEngland vs India, 2nd Test: India rested Jasprit Bumrah for the big-ticket clash in Birmingham. Akash Deep returned to the XI while Washington Sundar and Nitish Reddy also got their chances in place of Shardul Thakur and Sai Sudharsan.

2nd Test Day 1 Highlights: Jadeja, Shubman guide India to 310 for 5 at StumpsIndia vs England Highlights, 2nd Test Day 1: Shubman Gill and Ravindra Jadeja's unbeaten 99-run stand for the sixth wicket has helped India finish the opening day with 310 for five in 85 overs. Gill, who scored hundreds in back-to-back Tests, stayed not out on 114.

Day 3 schedule: Alcaraz, Raducanu in 2nd round, Bopanna begins campaignWimbledon 2025: Defending champion Carlos Alcaraz and World No 1 Aryna Sabalenka play second round matches on Wednesday. India's doubles players, including Rohan Bopanna, begin their campaigns in London.

Ishan's iconic 200: The moment Dhawan knew his India career was overShikhar Dhawan revealed that Ishan Kishan's 200 vs Bangladesh gave him the realisation and he accepted that his time with the Indian team was well and truly over.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
